query.description: Object that contains a set of search criteria to search proteins for.

operation.description: Logical operation used to combine the search result of the individual query parts. Possible values are AND, OR, NAND and NOR.

query_type.description: Identifies the type of search to be performed. Currently only search_protein is supported.

uniprot_canonical_ac.description: This value is used to search by protein ID. This can either be a complete UniProtID or a part of a UniprotID.

refseq_ac.description: This value is used to search by refseq accession number. This can either be a complete ID or a part of a ID.

mass.description: This object is used to search proteins by their mass. The object consists of a minimum and a maximum value specifying a mass range to search for.

min.description: Minimum value for the mass range to search for proteins. The value is specified in Dalton.

max.description: Maximum value for the mass range to search for proteins. The value is specified in Dalton.

organism.description: This field is set if a search by organism (e.g. human) is performed. The value can either be a scientific species name (NCBI Taxonomy), a synonym or a NCBI Taxonomy ID.

protein_name.description: This value is set for a search by protein name. The value can either be a complete protein name or a partial name.

gene_name.description: This value is specifies to search proteins by their gene name. The name can either be a complete name or a partial name.

go_term.description: This value is used to search by go term. The value can either be a complete go term or a partial go term.

go_id.description: This value is used to search by go id. The value can either be a complete go id or a partial go id.

pmid.description: This value is used to search by pmid. The value can either be a complete pmid or a partial pmid.

glycan.description: This object is used to search proteins by a glycan. This can either by an attached glycan or a glycan that gets bound by the protein.

relation.description: Describes the relationship of the glycan with the protein. Possible values are attached (for glycans that glycosylate the protein), binding (for glycans that bind to a protein) or any (includes both).

glycosylated_aa.description: Search a protein by its glycosylated amino acids.

operation.description: Specifies type of operation to perform.

aa_list.description: The value is a list of amino acid types in one letter code.

aa_sequence.description: Amino acid sequence to search for. The sequence is specified in one latter code. Depending on the type it has to be a complete sequence or a part of a sequence.

type.description: Type of sequence search. Possible values are exact (find proteins with exactly this sequence),or blast (proteins that are similar).

pathway_id.description: Search for proteins involved in a certain pathway. The pathway is specified by its name.

glycosylation_evidence.description: Search for proteins based on the evidence for the glycosylation sites. Possible values are calculated, experimental, none or any.
